title: Isolate the Radical
text: Isolate the radical on one side of the equation. We can subtract 2 on both sides get $$\sqrt{5v-2}=-5$$ which has radicals isolated on one side.

title: Check for Value of Square Root Function
text: The square root functions only take positive y value. In other word, $$\sqrt{x}=y$$ is defined when y is non negative real number.

title: Check for Value of Square Root Function
text: $$\sqrt{5v-2}=-5$$ does not have solution since -5 is negative.
